message: Nice site, Clean, Easy to navigate, Very clear.  Nice job.  The yellow really catches my eye.  Do you ship internationally (Canada)?

The address is www.snackandmunch.com, give me your feedback and input on how I could improve it.  We had orders coming in the very first day so it was REALLY exciting!  Place an order with the promo code 2BUCKS and get a discount!
Yeah nice site
@MarkLaViolette thanks!  we're not shipping international yet, just US... maybe in the future.

The concept is easy to understand, and the layout is great and easy to navigate. I went through the process of picking snacks and placed an order to test out your service. - A few comments - You really should add a handful of quick picks, or "themed groups" of snacks - going through and having to pick a bunch of stuff seems to take longer than it really should. Next - why did you choose 24 as your magic number? Seems like a very odd number indeed. and finally - maybe after a customer complete's checkout, you should prompt to post something to a social network site? Like "I just ordered a snack box at Snack&Munch" - it would help spread the word.

Lol - i even forgot to use the coupon code...oh well. - Another thing though, you might want to do some kind of twitter promotion where you RT whatever message you post for a chance at a snack box giveaway - gets people to RT you a lot and help spread the word and also gets you to more traffic to the site.
very interesting idea.

@Mattarata THANKS!  Your feedback is great!  I'm going to add the social stuff this week, just didn't have time yet.  Oh and since you were nice enough to try the site and give me feedback I'll throw in some extra ;-)
It's going to make me even fatter
I love it!

@Mattarata we chose 24 because there are 20 work days in a month, so if a person is eating one snack a day they can get through a month.  The extra 4 are for those days when you want to eat a little more.
haha this is awesome
It looks greater, but too bad that it is all about selling addictive junk food.
Thanks guys for the great words of encouragement!  Now BUY SOME SNACKS :-D  Use the code 2BUCKS and get a discount!!!
But hey, it worked for Warren Buffet (Coca Cola, Snickers...), so I can't really blame you
People love instant gratification :) (good amounts of sugar)
Oh yeah, watch out for copyright enfringement via Phillip DeFranco, viral blogger;  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_r7iFZBO0bo&feature=player_detailpage
@Energypanacea wow i had not even seen or heard of DeFranco!  Thanks for your inspirational words :-)  Last night we got slammed with orders!  We were up till 3am packaging orders!!!

Great orange and yellow retro 70's look, and the monkey.  Stick with that on all your advertisement and packaging.  People will get excited from a distance to see their shipment come in and that will get everyone else's attention in the office.  You definitely want everyone in the office noticing when a Snack&Munch delivery comes in.  It will be contagious.  GL
I'm so into this idea, but I'm in Australia. If you guys ever expand internationally I'll be all over you.
I'm totally missing why if I am hungry now I would order online and wait. That's not logical.
This will work better as a gift service I bet.

@ammar YW Glad to see this taking off.  You've got a winner for sure.  The amount of junk food stashed in the workplace is unbelievable.  People will throw out last years tax reports to make room for Frito Lay in the file cabinet.  Continued GL.
Lastly, I hope you'll ship to Europe someday and accept Paypal-payments :D

Cool idea, and nicely done indeed! I agree with @Mattarata that there should be some pre-picked orders, to make it easier and order :) For example make a group of healthy/healthier snacks, or a group of most popular picked snacks.
You should add a (+) button next to the snacks to add just 1 to the cart.
Also, bigger snack images would be appreciated, I have to squint a little bit to decide. But I have a big resolution (MBP 1600x1200)
Nice website! Great Idea!
And maybe color those you've already added to your cart so you know which ones you've added and maybe add a little number on a corner showing how many do u have on ur cart...
Ahhhh!!! I want this service in mexico naoooo!!!
Great site. Just a comment, add an "Add" button to the snacks to increment in 1...

@Mas90guru that's what we've been seeing, a lot of people are using Snack&Munch as a gift service, but then there are many people using it to stash up on their favorite snacks at work.  Planned snacking :-)  It's something many people do, they get their snacks ahead of time and keep them in their desk drawer, then when they are hungry they just pull something out instead of digging for change for the vending machine.
@matwill thanks :-) maybe one day
@koopa58 we are actually working on that, many people have recommended this
@nmelo if you click the details link then a bigger image will pop open

@BraveheartMTL thanks we think it's a great idea too, but so does NBC :-)  http://www.nbcwashington.com/the-scene/food-drink/Online-Vending-Machine-119185494.html  NBC wrote about us only after 1 week of launching the site!
@hpcorona i had thought about adding some color or a little green check mark next to those that have already been placed in your snackpack, we'll do it soon! thanks
@Energypanacea That's why I started Snack&Munch, I would see my co-workers bringing in Walmart bags of their snacks and I was like HMMMM, I can automate that for you :-)
Awesome idea. How much revenew/sales are you seeing?

@ammar Hey, that's an awesome idea you have there. I run a startup developing, producing, packaging and marketing unique gourmet bar snacks with lots of crowdsourcing elements, we've been endorsed by Gary Vaynerchuk and others (check out bar-deli.tv for the interview - our main site bar-deli.se is still only in Swedish) - How do I reach you for a dialogue about distribution of our products?  Cheers, Niclas
Love it. Great work.  You belong here https://convore.com/hacker-news/inspiredbeta-discover-beta-projectsstartups/ :)
Like the site design a lot! May I suggest an HTML5 web app for us mobile users? Great idea, too!
@niclasj you can also call the phone number that is on our website.  www.snackandmunch.com
@barcelonaFC yeah we're building a mobile app soon, we might use html 5... not sure yet tho.
@niclasj can you please email us at support@snackandmunch.com, we'd love to have a  taste of your product.
@inspiredMark thanks!
@joajimenez about 500+ customers and we are still growing it organically without massive advertising.  plus we have our full time jobs still
hi

Not sure if you've thought of this already, but there's a giant market to be tapped: parents wishing to buy snacks for their kids' lunches.  As a parent, we want to get healthy snacks that pack well in their lunches and our only bulk buying choice is Costco.  As the Donald would say, "it would be hyuge." Same purchase/eat metrics, 5 days a week, 1 snack a day, maybe a few extra for either same day after school or on the weekend.  Allow the kids to browse and pick their own snacks (often a complaint), awesome!  Also, doesn't change during summer bc kids take lunch to camp and/or want to bring snacks for a trip. Do I get equity for this market idea? ;)
Waaay to many drop downs. How about a button to click, that just adds to the cart? Click three times to add 3 candy bars... Maybe just "+" and "-" buttons?
3 FB like buttons on one page?  Below the register and login process?  You have a great site there no need to be so worried about being liked!
Pretty slick. I would improve page load times but other than that it looks awesome.
